verses.text: You must not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep that has any blemish or defect, for that is detestable to the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Retains direct warning about animal sacrifice—'detestable' for clarity, as per Hebrew 'toevah'.

verses.text: If there is found among you, within any of your towns that the LORD your God gives you, a man or a woman who does what is evil in the sight of the LORD your God and transgresses His covenant,
verses.comment: ‘Transgresses His covenant’ closely follows original phrasing, keeping gender reference.

verses.text: by going and serving other gods and worshipping them, whether the sun or moon or any of the host of heaven, which I have forbidden,
verses.comment: Explicit enumeration 'sun or moon or any of the host of heaven' for clarity.

verses.text: and it is told to you and you hear of it, you must investigate thoroughly. If it is true and certain that such an abomination has been committed in Israel,
verses.comment: ‘Investigate thoroughly’ mirrors Hebrew intent; ‘abomination’ for 'toevah'.

verses.text: then you must bring out to your city gates the man or woman who has done this evil deed, and stone that person to death.
verses.comment: ‘City gates’ included for accuracy; capital punishment as per context.

verses.text: At the mouth of two or three witnesses the one who is to die shall be put to death. No one shall be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
verses.comment: ‘Mouth’ for Hebrew idiom (‘at the mouth of’ witnesses).

verses.text: The hand of the witnesses shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people. In this way you shall purge the evil from among you.
verses.comment: Witnesses initiate justice, consistent with the original.

verses.text: If any case arises that is too difficult for you to judge—matters of bloodshed, legal rights, or assault, cases of dispute within your town gates—then you shall go up to the place that the LORD your God chooses.
verses.comment: Explicit types of cases retained as per Hebrew; 'town gates' added for context.

verses.text: You must come to the Levitical priests and to the judge who is in office in those days, and you shall consult them, and they will declare to you the verdict in the case.
verses.comment: ‘Levitical priests’ and ‘judge’ retained; translated ‘verdict’ for clarity.

verses.text: You shall follow the instruction they give you at the place that the LORD will choose, and you must be careful to do exactly as they direct.
verses.comment: ‘Be careful to do’ maintains original’s emphasis on obedience.

verses.text: You must act according to the instruction they give you and the ruling they pronounce; do not turn aside from what they declare to you, neither to the right nor to the left.
verses.comment: Original idiom ‘not to the right nor to the left’ retained.

verses.text: Any man who acts arrogantly and refuses to listen to the priest who stands to minister there to the LORD your God, or to the judge, that man shall die. You shall purge the evil from Israel.
verses.comment: ‘Acts arrogantly’ for Hebrew ‘presumes’; capital punishment retained.

verses.text: And all the people shall hear and fear and will not act arrogantly any longer.
verses.comment: ‘Hear and fear’ is a literal rendering.

verses.text: When you come to the land that the LORD your God is giving you, and you possess it and live in it, and then say, 'I will set a king over me like all the nations around me,'
verses.comment: Condition expressed in future anticipation as per original text.

verses.text: then you must set a king over yourselves whom the LORD your God chooses. You must appoint one from among your brothers; you must not put a foreigner over you, someone who is not your brother.
verses.comment: ‘Brothers’ retained as per Hebrew for national identity.

verses.text: But he must not acquire many horses for himself or cause the people to return to Egypt in order to get more horses, since the LORD has told you, 'You shall never go back that way again.'
verses.comment: ‘Return to Egypt’ maintains the original prohibition.

verses.text: And he must not acquire many wives for himself, lest his heart turn away. Nor must he acquire excessive silver and gold for himself.
verses.comment: Original warnings on wives and wealth preserved.

verses.text: And when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, he shall write for himself a copy of this law in a book, approved by the Levitical priests.
verses.comment: ‘Copy of this law’ is a literal rendering; Levitical priests retain oversight.

verses.text: And it shall be with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the LORD his God and to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, doing them.
verses.comment: Continuous reading and obedience emphasized as per Hebrew construct.

verses.text: So that his heart may not be lifted up above his brothers, and that he may not turn aside from the commandment, either to the right or to the left; so that he may continue long in his kingdom, he and his children, in Israel.
verses.comment: Purpose statement for humility and obedience; ‘in Israel’ retained for location.
